definition: home base/home plate (in baseball)
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
home run (baseball)

sentences.english: Hitoshi hit a four-bagger down here at the park last night.
sentences.chinese: 仁志昨晚在公園裏打出了一個本壘打。

sentences.english: He hopes Pfizer can develop those home-run drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他希望輝瑞能研發出成功的抗癌藥物，打出本壘打。

sentences.english: The runner tried to get to the base, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 跑壘員試圖想跑回本壘，但已經太遲了。

sentences.english: Five Yankees had run-scoring hits in the frame.
sentences.chinese: 共有五位洋基球員在他的投球下回到本壘。

sentences.english: That hasn’t exactly led to a home run.
sentences.chinese: 確切地說，這並沒有帶來一個本壘打。

sentences.english: If thrown right, a curveball drops right before it gets to home plate.
sentences.chinese: 假如投得正確，曲球會正巧在抵達本壘前墜下。

sentences.english: Barry Bonds broke the record for career home runs.
sentences.chinese: 邦茲破紀錄的職業生涯本壘打。

sentences.english: You hit too many homers and people start puffing you up.
sentences.chinese: 你打中了太多的本壘，於是人們開始把你捧上了天。

sentences.english: A White, Black, & an Ash Yellow homers.
sentences.chinese: 阿白，黑，灰及黃河的一個本壘打。

sentences.english: You have to be very quick to get an infield homer.
sentences.chinese: 必須要跑得很快才能打一個內場本壘打。

sentences.english: Paul batted three runs and toped off the game with a home run.
sentences.chinese: 保羅擊出一記三壘打，跑回本壘。

sentences.english: call balls and strikes behind the plate.
sentences.chinese: 在本壘板後判爲好球或壞球。

sentences.english: But then suddenly he stopped hitting home runs.
sentences.chinese: 但是他突然中止了打出本壘打的表現。

home run (baseball)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
evenly matched (idiom)

(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
Vanuatu, country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean
Heaven will not disappoint the person who tries (idiom). If you try hard, you're bound to succeed eventually.

to-and-fro tussle/closely-fought contest
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)

quarterfinals
